column5:
[chore] Update the license of the chat example (#3410)

There was no obvious reason to use BSD instead of MIT for that very basic chat app.

Closes #3411
[feat] Add cache-control header when serving the client source (#2907)
[docs] Add Touch Support to the whiteboard example (#3104)

[fix] Throw an error when trying to access the clients of a dynamic namespace (#3355)

Accessing the clients of a dynamic namespace throws because doing `io.of(/your-regex/g)` returns a namespace with no adapter and the clients methods tries to access `namespace.adapter.clients`.
[docs] Use new JavaScript syntax inside the README (#3360)

[docs] fix `this` scope in the chat example

`user is typing` messages were not properly removed

Closes #3291

[feat] Add local flag to the socket object (#3219)

To match the behaviour on the namespace (see #2628).
[docs] Convert the chat example to ES6 (#3227)

[docs] Clarify private messaging in the emit cheatsheet (#3232)

The previous version was confusing, as `socket.to(socket.id).emit()` does nothing.

Fixes #3220

[feat] Add support for dynamic namespaces (#3195)

This follows #3187, with a slightly different API.

A dynamic namespace can be created with:

```js
io.of(/^\/dynamic-\d+$/).on('connect', (socket) => { /* ... */ });
```
[docs] Add note in docs for `origins(fn)` about `error` needing to be a string. (#2895)

[fix] Include the protocol in the origins check (#3198)

Previously, the protocol was not taken in account, which caused the following behaviour:

```js
io.origins('https://foo.example.com:443'); // ok as a string
io.origins(['https://foo.example.com:443'); // not ok as an array
```

Fixes #3190

[fix] Properly emit 'connect' when using a custom namespace (#3197)

When using a custom namespace with a middleware, the client did not receive the 'connect' event.

Fixes #3082
[docs] Add link to a Dart client implementation (#2940)
[test] Use npm scripts instead of gulp (#3078)
[docs] Fix a grammar mistake in the API docs (#3076)
[docs] Actually prevent input from having injected markup in chat example (#2987)
[docs] Use path.join instead of concatenating paths (#3014)
[fix] Reset rooms object before broadcasting from namespace (#3039)
[fix] Do not throw when receiving an unhandled error packet (#3038)
[docs] Add io.emit in the cheat sheet (#2992)

[fix] Reset rooms object before broadcasting (#2970)

It seems packets could be delivered to wrong room in some case, if the
_rooms array was not reset before the next emit.

[fix] Fix middleware initialization (#2969)

Fix "TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object" when a
middleware is added before the engine is properly attached.

[docs] Update slack badge (#2961)

Update badge to https://slackin-socketio.now.sh/badge.svg

[fix] Fix timing issues with middleware (#2948)

Using a middleware could previously lead to a connecting client
receiving a connect event from the server before the server triggers
its own connect event.
[docs] Add an example of custom parser (#2929)
[chore] Added backers and sponsors on the README (#2933)
[feat] Move binary detection to the parser (#2923)
[docs] Replace non-breaking space with proper whitespace (#2913)
[docs] Explicitly document that Server extends EventEmitter (#2874)
[docs] Fix wrong space character in README (#2900)
[feat] Allow to join several rooms at once (#2879)

[chore] Bump engine.io to version 2.0.2 (#2864)

Includes the following (from engine.io changelog):

* [fix] Initialize the WebSocket server in the Server constructor (#476)
* [chore] Bump ws to version 1.1.2 (vulnerability fix) (#480)
[docs] Update the wording to match the code example (#2853)
[feature] Merge Engine.IO and Socket.IO handshake packets (#2833)
[docs] Small addition to the Express Readme Part (#2846)
[feature] Allow the use of custom parsers (#2829)

[fix] Use path.resolve by default and require.resolve as a fallback (#2797)

Browserify doesn't support require.resolve, and as a consequence, makes nexe fail the compilation. This PR attempts to get the path of the socket.io-client file via path.resolve and falls back to the original require.resolve if this file cannot be found.
[docs] Add a 'Features' section in the README (#2824)
[docs] Add pingInterval/pingTimeout/transports options in the API documentation (#2814)
[docs] Add an example for socket.join() method (#2813)
[docs] Fix a typo on `clients` method in the API documentation (#2812)
[docs] Fix wrong argument name in API.md (#2802)
[fix] Prevent null from being accepted as argument (#2606)

[fix] Fixes socket.use error packet  (#2772)

* fix(socket): Fixes socket.use error packet which drops nodejs due to nuances of Nodejs' EventEmitter

* fix(socket): Fixes missing error event on socket

* fix(socket): test fix, should listen for clientSocket instead of server socket

* minor update

[chore] Update client location and serve minified file (#2766)

Following https://github.com/socketio/socket.io-client/pull/1025, the
output files are now generated in the dist directory.

[feature] Add a `local` flag (#2628)

That new flag will prevent the adapter (redis) from publishing the emit to the pub/sub server.

When several instances of a server receive the same event from a third party (not from a client), each server instance broadcasts the event to all his clients. With the local flag, and the change in the redis adapter, each server instance send the event only to his client, so each client receive only one unique event.

[docs] Fixed grammar issues in the README.md (#2159)

Added a few periods and commas which were missing. Pluralised the word
'parameter' where it was incorrectly specified to singular on line 281.
Very minor edit. No source code changed.
[docs] Comment connected socket availability for adapters (#2081)
[example] Add disconnection/reconnection logs to the chat example (#2675)

[fix] Don't drop query variables on handshake (#2745)

Parameters passed during handshake, such as tokens, were being dropped.
[feature] Add support for all event emitter methods (#2601)

[test] Fix leaking clientSocket (#2721)

Test 'should be able to close sio sending a port' defined a clientSocket
but didn't set 'reconnection: false'.

Now, the default behavior of a clientSocket is 'reconnection: true'.
As a result, the clientSocket was "leaked" from the test case
and seemed to intermittently connect to the servers in subsequent
test cases. This would cause other tests to timeout unexpectedly.

It's not clear to me why this would happen, since the test case
assigns a unique port number to the socket.
However, if you go into socket.io-client and assign and log
unique IDs to each socket, then you'll see that this clientSocket
shows up in other test cases if the reconnectionDelay strikes
unluckily.

[feature] Loading client script on demand. (#2567)

Support for the serving of the client script mess with packagers like
browserify, webpack. Especcialy in projects where it is not used at all.
This patch is workaround to avoid that problem in the cases when client
script is not served.

[fix] Make ETag header comply with standard. (#2603)

The standard says that an ETag must be surrounded in double quotes:

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

Although browsers tend to be lenient, omitting the quotes can confuse/break some kinds of proxies and other tools that demand compliant formatting. For example, Sandstorm.io enforces strict HTTP usage for security reasons and will block responses with invalid ETags.
[test] Use client function to unify `client` in test script (#2731)
[chore] Add Github issue and PR templates (#2733)
[docs] Link readme npm package badge to npm registry page (#2612)

[docs] Fix JSDoc of optional parameters (#2465)

Making proper optional Docs for socketIO
[feature] Add a 'disconnecting' event to access to socket.rooms upon disconnection (#2332)
[chore] Link build badge to master branch (#2549)
[chore] Restrict files included in npm package (#2709)
[chore] Point towards current master of socket.io-client (#2710)

Merge pull request #1936 from drewblaisdell/master

Allow null or undefined origins when allowed origins is a function

Allow null or undefined origins when allowed origins is a function

Requests without an Origin header previously caused an exception to be thrown if the allowed origins passed to the constructor was set to a dynamic function. Omitted origins are now set to an asterisk and passed properly to the origins function.

A test for this case is included in this commit.

Merge pull request #1682 from kevin-roark/fix/disconnect-connectbuffer-crash

Fixed the failing test where server crashes on disconnect involving connectBuffer

Fixed the failing test where server crashes on disconnect involving connectBuffer

Source of bug: after connection to nsp '/', the socket's connectBuffer
was being deleted. On attempt to reconnect to a different namespace,
the connect buffer was deleted and we attempted to push to it. Instead
of the deleting the connect buffer, it is now emptied.

Merge pull request #1440 from kevin-roark/add/binary-broadcasting

Added binary support to broadcasting of events

Added binary support to broadcasting of events

lib/namespace.js previously was not considering whether an event had
binary data and was giving all events parser.EVENT type -- now it uses
the has-binary-data module to set the event type appropriately.

Then, after this fix there was a problem with lib/adapter.js -- because
socket.io-parser modifies the packet object in its encoding, the sockets
after the 1st in a broadcast were not getting the correct data. To fix
this, the data is encoded once in adapter, and then the encoded data
is passed to each of the sockets.

lib/socket.js and lib/client.js were updated to allow for the above. The
.packet method of each now takes an optional second "preEncoded" parameter
-- if this is true, then client skips the encoding and just writes the
packet argument directly to engine.

test/socket.io.js was updated to add two new tests that test
multi-messaging of events with binary data.

Merge pull request #1432 from kevin-roark/add/better-binary-events

Updated protocol-facing code for new binary protocol

Merge pull request #1437 from keyosk/master

Update chat example

When displaying leave and join messages show a message with an updated participants count.

Signed-off-by: Cody Massin <keyosk@gmail.com>

Updated protocol-facing code to reflect newest parser

Socket.io-parser now has a class-based Encoder and Decoder scheme,
so client.js was changed appropriately.

The main difference is that most of the logic for interpreting packets
is now isolated to parser, and client receives a 'decoded' event when
parser has a reconstructed packet ready to go.

Updated protocol-facing code for new binary protocol

This is a squash of four boring commits. The gist is that client.js
encoding and decoding stuff was updated to take an array of encoded packets
to write, and to handle sequences of binary packets to decode. There was
also merging done with upstream. All tests are passing.

Merge pull request #1426 from brishin/binary

Binary
merged binary with upstream's new chat app

Added binary support to socket.io

This is a squash of about 25 commits, and here is a summary:

adamreis added initial binary test with the doge image.

kevin-roark updated binary tests and wrote some binary encoding protocol.

kevin-roark replaced the custom binary encoding with msgpack because we
have to handle arbitrary json that contains binary.

adamreis added some 'crazy' tests for emmiting and receiving events with
several types of data.

kevin-roark updated client.js to use socket.io-protocol's async encoding

Did a bunch of upstream merging.

Merge pull request #983 from GICodeWarrior/parser-recursion

Fix infinite recursion in Websocket parsers.

Fix infinite recursion in Websocket parsers.

If a client is feeding messages faster than server can handle them, infinite
recursion occurs.  Basically, the "overflow" data gets added to the parser and
it immediately parses a new message.

The fix pushes the processing of the next message (in this edge case) onto the
event queue.  This prevents the stack from recursing indefinitely.  This also
prevents a fast client from starving other clients.

Merge pull request #964 from crickeys/xhr_polling_disconnectSync

Fix disconnectSync getting ignored

Fix disconnectSync getting ignored

If using xhr-polling and a browser closes a tab or window, the
disconnectSync in the socket.io-client method is called which sends an
XHR request to the server indicating a disconnect. This line would cause
that to be ignored and so the server would have to wait for a timeout to
mark them as disconnect. This was possibly because it was sent from a
different tcp socket than the current connection.

Adding configuration variable matchOriginProtocol

matchOriginProtocol is meant to be used when running socket.io behind a
proxy. matchOriginProtocol should be set to true when you want the
location handshake to match the protocol of the origin. This fixes
issues with terminating the SSL in front of Node and forcing location
to think it's wss instead of ws.

Blacklist events

Added support for blacklisting events that are emitted from the client side.
Currently it's possible for a client do .emit('disconnect') and this will trigger
the disconnect event on the server.. Which can lead to major issues.

We should black list that by default. You can override or add more events by adding
them to the `blacklist` setting

Merge pull request #302 from 3rd-Eden/readme

Readme fixes
Create a new branch for fixing #287

Added handshake data normalizer function.
Changed; Make sure we store the `handshake data` in the hash of connected clients.

Added Redis store.
  - Simply leverages pub/sub for nodes communication
  - Makes sure own node doesn't consume its own messages
  - Optionally uses msgpack to encode data for higher speed than JSON
  - Opens two connections per node (one in pub/sub mode, one for normal redis)

Fixed signature of Socket#join in tests
Fixed style
Make sure to close websocket clients on session tests
Fixed xhr polling constructor to take request as parameter
Added req to websocket transport constructor.
Added req parameter to jsonp-polling constructor.
Make sure to take request as parameter in the http constructor
Make sure to take request as parameter in the polling constructor
Make sure to take request as parameter in the htmlfile constructor

Added Transport#discard. Mostly useful for when request/response cycles are load
balanced into different nodes.

Refactored Transport#end
Removed concept of transport pausing as we no longer have async buffers.
Removed forced parameter from .end call from disconnect
Added handler for heartbeat clear subscription
Removed the .end method to disregard whether it was forced or not

Removed all transport-specific methods from Memory store
Added publish/subscribe placeholders that basically do nothing.

Refactored Socket
  - initialize options in constructor
  - inherit from EventEmitter always
  - added generic Socket#client

Refactored Socket#disconnect to intelligently decide whether the disconnection has
to be forced or just destroy the storage, so that a re-opening of the transport is
not possible.

Added Socket#dispatch, in charge of intelligently determining whether the packet
has to be relied to other nodes to handle, handle it internally, or discarding it
if it's volatile from the local buffer provided the transport is not open.
Leverage Socket#dispatch to dispatch a message.
Changed; Socket#store now returns the client store.

Removed disconnect subscription per-socket (added unnecessary overhead with multiple
namespaces).
Make sure to leave rooms upon disconnection of a namespace (fixes some bug).

Removed the `join` callback, since it's not necessary (TCP based pub/sub guarantees
proper total ordering).

Added handleDisconnect method to emit the `disconnect` event when the socket is
disconnected due to network reasons, making sure we don't emit it on non-connected
namespaces.
Simplified global message dispatching by leveraging subscriptions.

Refactored client request handling:
 - removed the concept of async handshake, since we now keep track of open/closed
   clients and handshakes across all nodes (replication)
 - when a client closes temporarily, before the disconnection is triggered and before
   the transport is reopened in any node, we buffer messages in all nodes. We therefore
   remove the need for a complex message queue with a memory tradeoff (buffer redundancy).
Removed usage of Store#disconnect, replaced with a simple subscription.
Moved id generation method into the manager.
Added call to `initStore` to initialize subscriptions.

Added redis client dependency.
Removed >= from policy.
Fixed; bind both servers at the same time do that the test never times out.

Added test for broadcasting events in rooms.
Added test for broadcasting json to a room.

Reverted back to the `room` flag for Socket. This way we can call `SocketNamespace#in`
when we relay a packet to the namespace, instead of overriding the endpoint acting
directly on SocketNamespace#flag. In addition, the room is only useful for broadcasting,
and it has no effect on the client, so `endpoint` should remain untouched.
Added test for broadcasting an event.

Added test for broadcasting json.
Removed unnecessary connections counter in broadcast tests.

Added support for the Socket#broadcast getter in Socket#packet
Added Socket#setFlags for consistency with SocketNamespace.

get reset.
Fixed JSON double encoding.
Added test for sending json to all clients in a namespace.
Add test for sending json to a room.
Added test for emitting an event to a room.
Add test for sending to all clients in a given room.

Fixed Socket#to and Socket#join. Make sure that the name of the room preserves the
namespace as prefix, unless the namespace is ''. This prevents collisions between
rooms of the '' endpoint with other arbitrary endpoints.

Fixed SocketNamespace#in, editing the endpoint flag directly instead of creating
`room`.
Added missing socket id to Store#join call.
Fixed broken reference to SocketNamespace object in Socket#join.

Make sure to auto-join client to '' when handshaking.
Renamed internal clients dictionary to clientsMap to avoid collisions with
Store#clients.

Fixed volatile endpoint message test. The `connection` event of a custom endpoint

Added cross-connection heartbeat clearing. In a XHR transport, if the POST request

 - Minimize globals by only exposing `client` and `create`
 - Separate `http.Agent` per clients so that we can terminate all sockets at once.

Changed; only do forced disconnection handling for writable sockets. This prevents
